entry.title: From falling objects experiment to a simulated experiment
entry.content:
Today I attened the Science Method class. An interesting question discussed was the experiment of falling objects. Dr. Luft provided us some students' responses and let us to figure out the students' thinking and how to response to students properly.

We know the Galileo's Leaning Tower of Pisa experiment well. In fact, David Scott-Astronaut of Apollo 15-recreated Galileo's famous experiment on the Moon by Hammer and Feather Drop.

But the question caught my curiosity in the class was two ice cube droping from the same inclination.

I asked my classmates what happens in the following situations.

I acturally did the experiment using simulation environment.

The result is interesting. The second situation arrived the bottom using less time.
From Leaning Tower of Pisa Experiment to simulated experiment, what a big change technology has made to our science teaching and learning!
